name: Access Data Access Page
summary: Learn about .DAP files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: You can build data access pages from scratch within Microsoft Access or create them from other files, such as dBASE files, Paradox tables, spreadsheets, and text files.
NOTE: Microsoft Access 2007 and later versions do not support DAP files.

description: A file with .dap extension is a Microsoft Access Data Page file that is created from within Microsoft Access and has access to the data stored in the database. Data stored in such a web file is accessible over the network (intranet and internet) which is different than the Accessâ€™s MDB files which are developed for desktop applications specifically. Such databases can be created using Access 2010 and Access Services (an optional component of SharePoint). These databases can be used by people having SharePoint accounts using the web address in a web browser.
A DAP file is a webpage that is connected to an Access database. It can be used to distribute reports via the web or e-mail. DAP files may serve as data entry forms or generate interactive reports.

instructions: You can open and edit a DAP file in pre-2007 versions of Microsoft Access (Windows). You can view the webpage a DAP file describes by opening the file in Internet Explorer (Windows).
